intro: Cienfuegosia heterophylla, commonly known as the Cuban cienfuegosia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Cuba. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its alternate, ovate leaves that vary in shape depending on the age of the plant. Its flowers are typically yellow with five petals and are borne on axillary inflorescences. Cienfuegosia heterophylla is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as limestone cliffs and rocky soils.
